result.execSummary:
The defendant Perry Carothers Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Imposed and Stayed.
Concurrent with: Case 21CM1065

miscConds.notes: Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent. Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Mental Health Assessment. No contact with the victims P.M.O or M.P. (person, property, residence or family). Obtain and maintain full-time employment and/or schooling. Do not drive unless properly licensed. Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

Pay all court costs and supervision fees. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided. Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Perry Carothers Sr

records.addlTxt: Corrected 10/27/22 to add 27 days CFTS
Emailed dispatch at 9:25 AM to cancel warrant.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:14 AM Defendant Perry Carothers Sr in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeremy Michael Samuels in court for Perry Carothers Sr.  Attorney Jacob Nelson Garman in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Defense is asking that the bonds not be forfeited. Makes statements on the record. Provides updated address for the defendant. Seeking to get cases resolved. 
State makes statements on the record. Does not object to reinstating the bond in each case. Puts global offer on the record. 
BTC: VACATE WARRANT and reinstate bond. Matter set over.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Bond forfeiture notice -
     Order forfeiting bail and notice of application for judgment.  Missed court 7/8/2022. $200 cash bond ordered/requested forfeited.

Defense does not have an explanation for defendant's non appearance. Seeking that a bench warrant and bond forfeiture is stayed until the next court date. 
State does not object but court does. 
BTC: Bench warrant and bond forfeiture requested/ordered but is stayed for 72 hours.

Defense requests adjournment was just appointed. 
BTC: Matter adjourned.

DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
